alert.note: Alert for Orange; Riverside (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 22 at 9:20AM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 AM PST THIS MORNING FOR COAST AND WESTERN VALLEYS IN SAN DIEGO COUNTY... * WHAT...Areas of flooding caused by moderate to locally rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the a portion of Orange county covering parts of the Santa Ana mountains and western San Diego county. * WHEN...Until 1130 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water on roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 915 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated moderate to locally heavy rain. Areas of minor flooding have been reported. Between 0.25 and 0.6 inches of rain have fallen in the past 3 hours, locally over an inch along northern San Diego County coast. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 inch to 0.75 inches, locally up to 1 inch, possible over the area into the late morning and early afternoon. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chula Vista, Oceanside, Carlsbad, El Cajon, Vista, Encinitas, National City, La Mesa, Poway and Imperial Beach. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
